Hands down the worst "Japanese" food you can find in San Francisco.  Where to begin?

1. It's busy busy busy, meaning you have to wait on line to recieve your punishment.  I use that line as a retort when people mention "common sense" or "human dignity" - "oh really?  Explain the Tokyo Express lunch line then!?" is my response, always followed by silence heralding my decisive victory.

2. The "sushi" is grade-Z.  The fish smells, it's clearly been frozen and defrosted (multiple times!?) and has the color of the ancient wax sushi's you find in musty cases outside sushi restaurants.  NOTHING is good!  Not the tuna (how do you mess THAT up?), not the salmon, not the ebi, and don't even bother with anything more fancy like hamachi.  Not unless you're there to commit suicide.

3. The bento boxes / teriyaki / donburi are criminal.  I'm not kidding.  The vegetables are under or overcooked (depending on the position of the stars), the meat is high-school cafeteria grade, and none of it will be the right temperature.  Even the boxes they come in are sticky - do they wash them or just rinse them out?

4. The "service" is non-existant.  It's your standard wage-slave feeding trough - grab a number, wait for the shambler to plop your "food" on the table and good luck to you, brave (foolish) diner!

There is a ray of hope, however!  If you don't go here, but to the sister restaurant north of market (waaay north, near the Transamerica building) you'll find a significantly different experience.  It's like the good twin to this evil twin.  I'd give THAT Tokyo Express three stars because it's actually quite good for what you pay (and can get in this area) - hell, I eat the sushi there without grimacing, and their bento boxes are what you'd expect from a decent place.
author: Matt H.

description: All I needed to see was the Dept. of Health scorecard with a "79" with a handwritten post-it note attached asserting "All violations have been corrected".
author: Robert T.

description:
I knew Tokyo Express Teriyaki House 2 is usually disastrous. I don't mean to be racist but Japanese joints run by non-Japanese people are not a good idea except Hong Kong Chinese. They are completely adaptive they can make any ethnic cuisine tastes great.

Ordered the Curry Chicken special. It was around $8 and it tasted so repulsive I had to spit it out. It tasted worse than right out of a curry sauce packet. Carrots and potatoes were stewed for more than 10 hours they are becoming a puree unintentionally. There were even traces of shredded chicken. I suspect they cooked it for so long the chicken from yesterday's pot disintegrated and became this mush. Anyone who serves a pile of shit like this has no pride nor dignity and should not be running or working in a restaurant.

IT WAS JUST DISGUSTING. I WOULDN'T EVEN FEED IT TO MY DOG.

Seriously, I'd rather pay $13 for the SFO airport curry rice with no meat in it.
author: DANIEL T.

description:
I ate here.  

Once.  

3.5 years ago.

'Nuff said.
____________________
author: Jeff P.

description:
DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. If you read anything from this review, read that first line.

The place is tempting, as their street signs along Spear and Main highlight their "rainbow sushi" and "tempura" special, but when my co-worker and I went there, it was horrible. There was no seats and no one working there was bussing tables, so we litterly had to bus our own chops to get a decent seat. Then after receiving the food, the miso soup was cold.. what gives.. I left that aside and waited for the main course... "Chicken Teriyaki". 

That is my main japanese course, and I judge every Japanese restaurant by that measure. Unfortunately, TETH not only missed the mark, but missed it by a whole lot. This had the worse Chicken Teriyaki I have had. Within my chopsticks, I probably had more skin than meat. The salad was a joke on a small plate of lettuce, a few shreads of what seemed like carrot and vinegette. Okay.. very Japanese... and the employees speaking Mandarian really gave me more comfort when I was eatting my small portioned teriyaki.

On the other hand, my co-worker ordered sashimi and was very disappointed by the outcome.. it was chewy and unfortunately not fresh.  We both left the place and vow never to return. Nor should you spend your hard earned money there.
author: Wilson L.

description:
This is a great work-lunch place.  I come here a lot with friends, or alone, and usually don't have to wait too long for my food or a table.  It's not amazing by any means, but it's good and not too expensive. 

The trick is knowing when to go.  If you go between 12-130, good luck, it's going to be crowded, often times with lines out the door.  But  even if you go during these times, suprisingly, you can usually be seated because there is ample seating, and quick service.

I have gotten a bunch of things, but I think my favorite is the jumping tail roll (I think that's the name, it's yellow tail that has been deep fried...mmmm).  It's cheap and really filling.

Their miso soup is also pretty good, and I like their udon and donburi.  So, yeah, I wouldn't come all the way from Nob Hill to go here, but it's perfect for work :)
author: Kristin E.

description:
First and hopefully only time I've ever actually gagged after putting sushi in my mouth. If for some reason you think the descriptors "fresh and edible" need not apply to your sushi, you'll love this place. If like most of the world, you know that sushi should not resemble and taste like five year old play-doh, for the love of all things sacred, don't walk through the door.

Only other thing I have to add is, the prices aren't even cheap. If you really want to brave it, you're sure to leave in complete awe that the place even exists.
author: sarahjane s.

description:
I love sushi, like I really love sushi. So I need to have a spot near my office and this place being down the street totally fits the bill. I really wanted to love this place because it was so convenient, but it came up a bit short in my book. 

I went there during lunch and this place gets PACKED. I ordered some sashimi and a spicy tuna hand roll. Nothing fancy. I got the sushi fairly quickly but when I got the office the servings were quite underwhelming. Now i know this is sushi but the spicy tuna hand roll had hardly any tuna in it at all and the sashimi slices were probably the smallest I've had at a sushi restaurant. 

All that being said, the quality of the fish was ok and the service was fast. Just if you go, you may not get a lot of fish in your rolls and you better order extra orders of sashimi.

*tip* If you go for lunch, try getting there like 11:55. Those 5 minutes make all the difference in the world on having to wait forever or not...
author: Michael P.

description:
Mediocre sushi, glaring unhappy cashiers, and obnoxious signs to tip all over the place. Plus, they always try to add a dollar to my credit card transaction. Um, I don't think so ladies. This female balances her checkbook and Momma ain't havin' that kinda thing AT ALL.

One extra star for the understanding and (seemingly) sympathetic manager.
author: Katie D.

description: I come here for lunch at least twice a month. I always try to be there by 11:30am because it is PACKED by 12:05pm. And when they say Tokyo Express, it really is express. I just went to lunch there with my co-worker a few days ago, and we had barely gotten settled in our seats when our bento boxes came out. If you want to be sure to be back at your desk from lunch on time, I definitely recommend this place. Because it's Tokyo EXPRESS, I'm guessing that's why they don't have the servers walking around refilling your tea; you have to get up and get the tea yourself. I don't mind though. It's free.
author: Roenna A.

description:
I eat here. But they have overcharged my card.  And I have had tempura broccoli that wasn't fully cooked.  And chewy sashimi. However, it isn't as if the FiDi is overflowing with good lunch options.  The udon is pretty good, and the shrimp tempura rolls are as well.  I'm not saying this place is good, but for when I want something other than a sandwich or salad, this is a good option. They have some good deals -- usually a fancy roll or nigiri, a california roll, a soup and a salad for about $8.

Edited to remove 2 stars.  I have twice had fish (salmon & yellowtail)  that was completely inedible - once with nigiri and once with maki.  I couldn't bite through the fish.  It was a sickening sensation.  I will never get the fish from this place again. I recommend no one else does either.  I might still get udon or tempura but... eew.
author: Heidi P.

description: Packed at lunch.  Would prefer more combo lunch choices - there is only 1 combo unless you want to add tempura to your order.  Food is all pre-cooked and assembled upon order.  Wouldn't be so bad if was actually served warm/hot.  More than 1 occassion, the tempura or teriyaki item was cold in the center - ick!
author: Kim S.

description:
Nice and friendly service for when I want to have a real sit-down lunch in a short amount of time.  The entrees usually come with free miso soup and a salad (both worth the extra calories).  They usually have daily specials as well.  I ordered the nabeyaki udon yesterday and it was delish, minus the soggy tempura.  But, I believe the laws of science tell you that putting fried things into soup will turn said fried things soggy.

Will definitely return.
author: Jenny L.

description:
So, to continue with my cheap business week lunch fixes, I call this my "Tuesday Tokyo Express" day. I usually get the special with the crunchy California roll. That's really all folks. 

Beside RTF Delica in the Ferry Building or Ozumo's, this is the next best thing for a Japanese luncheon in the FiDi. And it's a huge step down...make sure you don't trip on your way down. Set the expectations low.
author: Cathy H.

description:
Given the lack of affordable sushi within walking distance -- this place is alright.  It's a step above supermarket sushi, and it's not hideously expensive like the other places around here.  A decent sushi lunch will run you $10-$15.  The fish is fresh enough, doesn't taste fishy or slimy, but the cuts are a bit on the meager side.

Good lunch place.
author: Eugene F.

description:
Just yesterday, my co-worker insisted that we come here for lunch.  While walking over, I asked her a few times if this place was any good.  
Each time I asked...she said "YES!" - If this co-worker of mine had a Yelp profile, I would be writing a second review about her POOR TASTE for Japanese food.  

I ordered the beef donburi which is a bowl of rice topped with some really chewy beef, a flat overcooked piece of egg, and pickled vegetables.  The order also came with a side of salad and miso soup.  All of the food was okay but I really had to do lots of chewing to get the pieces of teriyaki down.  They should really consider changed the name of this dish to Beef GroundBuri cuz it might be better off BURRIED...IN THE GROUND!  No, JK...it's edible.
author: Steve D.

description:
Tokyo Express was quite a "meh" experience...and with the deluxe bento box (the way to get sushi or sashimi with your teryaki) coming in at over $10, NOT a lunch time deal. 

The chicken was alright- not especially tender, but not too much gristle. The sauce was odd- thin, sort of flavorless, but with a few odd clumps of a gelatin-like substance. Tempura was luke-warm. Miso was miso, except for the sadly disintegrating cubes of sorry looking tofu. The sashimi was tuna- fine, but not the freshest I've had and quite veiny. 

Some people in our group that went with rolls fared better. It is a nice, large space, inset from Spear, so it is a relaxing respite from the grind. Still, a big meh.
author: Jenni D.

description: Their noodle soups are pretty good. The rolls are average and a bit on the small side. The tempura is cold and not fresh though. Good place for quick lunch with a coworker if you're in a hurry.
author: Christian C.

description:
I come here on rainy days because I don't want to walk far. It's near my work.

The udon is good. 5 stars for udon.
The sushi is terrible. It doesn't even deserve 1 star.
Just get the udon.

So I averaged this place to 3 stars.
author: Dennis W.

description: This place is a hit and miss with raw fish. Portions are a hearty size, service is quick (should be since this serves the work folks near by) and the place is clean. If I want sushi or sashimi and need it quick I'll walk the few extra blocks to get here, if I just want teriyaki chicken, there's places closer to my building I can get it from.
author: Gwen K.

description:
Best sushi in the Embarcadero area.  There.  I said it.  I've been experimenting with different sushi options over the past year, and this one is the winner.  For $6.99 you can get a delicious spider roll lunch with miso and salad.  I'll admit, the salad and soup aren't the greatest, but it does they job.  The sushi, however, its very tasty and it definitely fills you up.  

If you go here after the lunch time rush (after 1:00) they are very fast bringing out the food.

And today I discovered the Specialty's around the corner.  Now every time I come here to get sushi, I'm going to have to bring home a delicious cookie as well....
author: Katie S.

description:
Overpriced, mediocre sushi.  

$18 bought me a roll of sushi, 2 pieces of nigiri and miso soup - for lunch, I thought this was high.  Considering it was lunch and I ordered at a counter, etc - they should have been better priced. 

The worse part for me, was that my sushi was room temperature.  I dunno, it tasted odd - warm albacore nigiri.  I honestly get better, fresher tasting sushi/sashimi at Whole Foods.

I suppose thats a good way to put it - it tasted like pre-packaged/pre-made sushi for sit-down dinner sushi prices.

Will not go back.

I'll give them 2 stars for service, selection and cleanliness."
author: Fräulein J.

description: Came here to eat lunch with my co-worker this afternoon. The line was short; we ordered and paid at the cash register... got a table and waited for our food to come. The food came in 8 minutes - now that's quick! I had the lunch special tempura SOBA ($6.95); it came with a salad too. The portions are good, and the price is average. An extra star for the free self-served tea. I love tea! Considering the area, the food/price is reasonable.
author: Tom C.

description:
I'm giving this a 5 cuz it's the best reasonably priced lunch sushi place in the financial district, and since i love sushi and go out to eat lunch everyday, i look forward to my weekly visit here :).  My fave rolls:

Double Salmon Roll
Dragon Roll
Spicy Hamachi Roll
author: Labonee M.

description:
Why do I keep coming back???  Take out service is slooooooow whether it's during the lunch rush or after 2pm.  I dont git it. 

That being said, I like the sushi.  If you are a vegetarian (I'm not, but I love my veggies), they have a great, varied menu.  The yam tempura roll is pretty damn yummy.  

They offer lunch special pre-packs that contain the ubiquitous california roll, along with tuna, salmon, ebi, etc., as well as miso soup (VERY bland) and side salad (nice tangy dressing).  The idea is to grab the pre-pack sitting next to the register and go.  But you still have to wait for them to pack the soup and salad, which can take an inordinate amount of time.  Sometimes the raw fish in the pre-pack doesnt taste that fresh, probably because it's been sitting unrefrigerated by the heat generating cash register.  Oh, and if you dont get there by 11.30, the pre-packs already are gone.

So, I recommend ordering something off the menu.  You'll wait just as long and the meal will be fresher.

If you decide to visit this restaurant, dont do it when I'm there.  I'm so tired of waiting in long lines...
author: brewgirl b.

description:
This is tucked away in a little corner. $9 for 6 california rolls, 4 nigiri, soup, salad, and free water/tea.

Pretty tasty and fast. I would go back more often if it wasn't so far from my work.
author: Kitty N.

description:
Quick, easy and GOOOOOOD.  Plus, it is right across the street from my office.  SCORE.  

Granted it isn't the BEST sushi in the world but it's so convenient and it's good enough for lunch!  Watch out though it is CRAZY busy.  Better to go there and take your lunch to go!
author: Bree W.

description:
Ick.

Lets just say if you want good, fresh and reasonably priced food, this is not the place for you. If you are a big sushi eater, this is definitely not the place for you. The sushi is not fresh and doesn't taste good at all. i have gotten sushi at grocery stores that taste 10x better and I don't even think grocery store sushi is that good. Above all this, the prices are a little high. This place is close to my work and I have colleagues who really enjoy the Tempura Udon, which I think tastes way too fishy. The only thing I think on the mark here is the edamame, but really, how can you go wrong with edamame?
author: Melanie T.

description: If you are looking for a quick sushi lunch, then this is your place.  But if you actually eat sushi and love it, perhaps this is not the place for you.  They have some great specials - each day the rolls change and it comes with miso and salad.  You can walk out of there for $10.  I have eaten here a couple times with my sister when we work in the same office.  Each time we go, we don't feel well later in the day.  It's not worth the cheap meal to get the cheap side effects.
author: Arica V.

description: This is a typical, business-district Japanese place. The service is fast and the food is..meh. It's the kind of place where I'd never order the nigiri, might experiment with their rolls, and usually stick with the fully cooked stuff.
author: Albie L.

description:
Quick service, fresh fish, priced decently, consistent quality.  I must say though tempura's were cooked in over-used oil, and can be soaky.   

Of course, if you walk out the Embarcadero area, you'd find better tasting places but for a quick lunch take-out place, it's pretty satisfying.
author: MS Y.

description: What a scam!  This place is by work, we eat here 2-3 times a month, mostly because it's close and the food isn't bad.....and they take debit / credit cards.  Little did I know that they actually add an extra "tip" for themselves when the cards are processed.  We went yesterday and I rounded my bill up to the nearest dollar ($11).  Just looked at my bank account and the charge is for $13.01.  Then I looked back through past statements and it looks like a buck or two was tacked onto some of the other charges from Tokyo Express and I just never noticed.  Unfortunately they take your receipt when they deliver your food, so there is no proof.  It's not a lot of money, but is really annoying.  Either pay cash or go elsewhere.
author: Kristen N.

description:
tried sushi combo #2. twice.  also had the crab appetizers.  crab tasted wayyy too fishy for it to be good.  the first time i was there, i regretted going because the sushi combo did not taste that fresh.

but today... i went back and had FRESH great quality sushi.  I really had no complaints! they have complimentary hot tea, the lines werent long at all.  

combined grade for this place is a 3.  2 the first time i went, and 4 the second visit.  i hope there's more consistency here... but we will see!
author: Katelyn M.

description: This resaurant used to be on our catering rotation at work until we had to stop using them because of all the complaints.  This is truely the worst sushi I've ever had- and I am including safeway/albertsons/cala premade sushi.  And on top of that, they ALWAYS screwed up my order.  two chopsticks down!
author: Shanti G.

description: I only ever get the vegetable don, and it's OK.  Not especially yummy, but not especially heinous.  It *is* especially close to work.
author: Andi T.

description: A decent place to go for lunch. The prices are alright, but I think a bit high for what you get. I do like the service here although it can get crowded quick if you do not go early for lunch. I think their bento boxes are pretty good, but a bit on the bland side. If you are craving some mediocre Japanese food for lunch then this is an easy choice with quick service.
author: Tyler D.

description:
Note to self:
Never eat at a place with the word "Express" in it...okay Panda Express is an exception because every now and then I really crave their Orange Chicken bowls - there I said it! So I order their chicken teriyaki bento lunch. It's a rather large serving of chicken but I found it to just be edible but when I'm really hungry almost everything is EDIBLE! The sauce didn't really wow me but I didn't mind the miso soup (how hard is that to fuck up?). Okay the salad it came with - what the hell? The tomato is a meager wedge and it's not even red and I know it's not some fancy green tomato either and don't get me started on the dressing it's gross and doesn't do any favors for the iceberg lettuce it's sitting on! I don't think it's even worth a "do-over" even if my boss does offer to buy me lunch on some random day which is never so I guess I won't be coming back here. I gave it two stars just because I got my lunch order in less than 8 minutes!
here's an observation:
Can I get an edible wedge of an Orange in my bento box just once? Is that too much too ask for?
author: Alexis D.

description:
Since when does a  spider roll=a crappy california roll w/ crispy leg bits pressed on the two end pieces. Only 1/5 of this roll was anything near a spider roll.

Definitions

The California roll is a maki-zushi (roll), a kind of sushi, usually made inside-out, containing cucumber, imitation crab stick, and avocado.

The spider roll includes fried soft shell crab and other fillings such as cucumber, avocado, daikon sprouts or lettuce, roe, and spicy mayonnaise. 

I ordered a spider roll today especially because I DO not like fake crab stick..
author: Susannah M.

description: Ok, so it's Japanese fast-food.  But it's good Japanese fast-food.  I've eaten here a few times, and I've always been pleased with the food and service.  I recommend the beef teriyaki bento box with tempura.  Their spider roll's pretty good too.  There's always a line out the door, so they must be doing something right.
author: AC A.

description: I used to go here for decent and quick sushi.  But the last few times, the quality has deteriorated.  I had the spider roll today and it was fishy, the rice was hard and wet and the seaweed was soggy like it's been premade and sitting out for a while.  Bad bad bad.
author: C L.

description: The fish here gets the sniff test. That is, I am suspicious enough of the nigiri to smell it for freshness. It passed, but I would recommend sticking mostly to the cooked foods here. Not a bad place, overall. There's a big dining area and the restaurant itself is nicely tucked away from the street. Service was quick even with the huge noon-time crowd.
author: Patrick G.

description: No matter how many times you ask, no matter how sweetly you implore, no matter how much more money you offer, they WILL NOT allow you to substitute gyoza into the bento box.
author: Marcus C.

description: I work on Market Street near the Embarcadero and it's hard to find good sushi. If you know a better place let me know. It gets very busy during lunch, so call ahead of time to place your order. If you eat inside, it's pretty fast. I go to this place because I love the rolls. I haven't tried the sashimi yet because I'm trying to go through all the rolls first. They're pretty creative. My favorite is a roll (let's see how many times I can use "roll" in this review) that has salmon, mango, avacado, and spicy stuff; it's hella good. I have lots to choose from. I wouldn't know what their California roll tastes like, I don't waste my time on that amateur shit.
author: Tatiana D.

description: I don't get all the bad reviews, I like this place.. but then again not everyone is reviewing the sashimi.. The fish here is super fresh.. and I LOVE SUSHI and need fresh fish so I think I'm pretty good at picking out the good places.. I try to visit this place once a week.. Getting there before noon is key or you'll wait in a long line.. again if this place wasn't good there wouldn't be a long line everyday.. the line goes pretty quick so don't fret.
author: Monica S.

description: I am just ok with Tokyo Express.  The lines are out-the-door because there aren't any other cheap/quick Japanese places in the area that are any better.  The salmon teriyaki is good but you don't get much of it.  You get 3 razor thin slices of salmon with a ton of rice, half a cup of miso soup, and some iceberg lettuce with an extremely distasteful ginger-soy dressing.  I end up getting a california roll because an order of salmon teriyaki alone won't fill me up.  I have tried a couple of their rolls and I don't like them.  Their eel seemed kinda...over-cooked and rubbery?  I think the Stonestown location is a half-step up though.  They give you slightly more salmon teriyaki plus you get one or two orange slices, and their salad dressing is much better.  I know, not that big of a deal, but like I said it's a half-step up.
author: Kandi K.

description: Again, spitting distance from my office. I can only stomach the teriyaki salmon bento box. Tried the beef - fatty. Tried the chicken - gristly. Won't eat anything raw in here (I inspected the sushi prep area). Am always suspicious when friends tell me their sushi is warm...
author: Mi M.

description: Awesome cheap japanese lunch take-out  place.  Not a place I would venture to actually get sushi, but their simple teriyaki dishes are great.  Most food per dollar you can get in the financial district (except maybe hot dogs).
author: M P.

description: Pretty decent place to grab unique sushi rolls in the area.   The sushi specials are a deal as well.  it is not the best sushi in town. But for a quick and fast bite. This place can do it.   The udon soups are pretty decent as well.
author: Chris C.

description:
food wise, this is a 4, so get take out because the service is fairly awful. they are quick, but when i ordered chicken and got pork they insisted that it was chicken. it looked like, smelled like, tasted like pork and my friend agreed. they didn't apologise, they argued with me. i stood my ground and got chicken.
but the food is good. the katsu chicken, both bento box and katsudon are lovely and the teryiaki chicken excellent. their salad is just the right amount to accompany the rest. 
the miso soup wasn't nice. i'm not a fan anyway, but this tasted like a completely oversalted ready made microwave dish.
i have not yet tried the sushi, but look forward to it as it looks excellent
author: Alex R.

description: Definitely call in your order ahead of time. Sushi is pretty good, although a bit pricey. The place is a zoo at lunch time.
author: MK J.

description: I usually have an easy time to order my lunch to take-out but today I had the worst experience, along with a few others.  I went there around 2PM today which I thought it was after the mad lunch hour rush but I had to wait about 30 minutes for my Spider Roll Lunch special of the day to be made...don't they anticipate that customers might tend to order the lunch specials and be ready to make it???   Meanwhile half the dining room was closed off and empty!  It looks like the lady waiting behind me for her order got her money back and had a free lunch on the manager.  But I wasn't so lucky...eventhough I considered (past-tense) myself a regular customer...it will be awhile till I come back to order lunch again.  Maybe they will improve the process by then or maybe not.  Alakazam!
author: Ed Y.

description: O ordered Salmon Teryiaki - I waited 10 minutes for this, got back to my desk - and it's raw - barely even cooked. Great wasted lunch. Never going back.
author: Jason B.

description: I come here weekly for udon and some sushi. They're quick, friendly and reasonably priced given the generous portions. I'd recommend calling in your order and picking it up as the lines for ordering and seating can be long around the peak hours of service.
author: Andres G.

description: I agree with all the other reviewers. At this point, it's hard to add anything new. This place sucks. No reason to go there. I ordered the Deluxe Bento. The service was ridiculous. A scowling mean woman behind the cash register turned away from me as soon as I approached and I had to wait for her to turn back around and acknowledge me, then she screamed at me when I asked her what the difference was between a deluxe bento and a regular bento. I barely understood her hysterical response but ordered it anyway, what a mistake. The tempura was hard and cold and just plan disgusting. The white rice was hard and dry and crusty. The fish was so bad it does not qualify as seafood. If it was really fish, it must have been a quality level several notches below the lowest possible quality level. The samlon teriyaki was hard and the slices were almost as thin as paper. In fact, there was more of the sugary fake teriyaki sauce than there was actual salmon and the cabbage was inedible because of all the sauce. The tea was cold and tasteless. The miso soup tasted like some kind of military ration out of a can and had only smallest bits of tofu and a scap of old seaweed. Each table has a sign thanking in advance for our generous tips. Why would anyone in their right mind leave a generous tip for this?
author: Eater S.
